channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: To fix Starbucks, incoming CEO Brian Niccol will have to tackle its mobile app problem
item.description: When Brian Niccol steps in as CEO of Starbucks, he'll be tasked with fixing the chain's operational issues.

item.title: China's new loans hit a 15-year low, but investors 'should not panic'
item.description: China extended just 260 billion yuan of new loans in July, far less than the 450 billion yuan expected.

item.title: The first SpaceX spacewalk: What the Polaris Dawn commander says about the bold upcoming mission
item.description: The Polaris Dawn mission is the first of three flights Jared Isaacman bought from SpaceX in 2022 for his human spaceflight effort known as the Polaris Program.

item.title: TikTok 'finfluencers' accurately called the AI rally, but credibility concerns dog them
item.description: Experts warned against trusting advice from these finfluencers, but agreed that they provide a first step to promote investing awareness among young investors.

item.title: Why NASA astronauts are waiting to return on Boeing's Starliner
item.description: Boeing's Starliner capsule "Calypso" has been in space for 71 days and counting as the company and NASA try to identify whether its safe for its crew to return.

item.title: Cadillac reveals new 'Opulent Velocity' performance EV concept
item.description: GM's new all-electric Cadillac concept car is designed to preview how the automaker plans to keep its high-performance V-Series vehicles relevant for EVs.

item.title: Here's why Walgreens and CVS retail pharmacies are struggling — and what they're doing to fix it
item.description: Drugstores remain an important fixture of the U.S. health-care system that tens of millions of Americans rely on, but they may need to reinvent themselves.

item.title: Amazon’s troubled drone delivery program faces latest challenge in Texas: Annoyed residents
item.description: Amazon is seeking FAA approval to expand its drone delivery service in College Station, Texas, but many residents aren't too happy.

item.title: Disney's 'Deadpool & Wolverine' becomes the highest-grossing R-rated film of all time
item.description: The feat not only showcases the MCU's durability at the box office, but also suggests that Marvel Studios can delve into darker content.

item.title: U.S. crude oil falls more than 1% as Gaza cease-fire talks, global demand weigh on market
item.description: Gaza cease-fire talks are expected to resume in Doha, Qatar on Friday.

item.title: Bayer shares soar 11% after key U.S. legal win against Roundup cancer claims
item.description: Bayer shares rose as the company said it scored a legal victory in its suit over claims that exposure to its popular Roundup weed killer led to cancer.

item.title: 'Late low ball': Lawyer slams Deutsche Bank settlement offer in long-running Postbank suit
item.description: Claimants argue Deutsche Bank underpaid for its acquisition of German retail banking giant Postbank in the late 2000s.

item.title: British fintech Revolut valued at $45 billion in secondary share sale
item.description: British fintech startup Revolut said on Friday that it was valued at $45 billion in a secondary share sale that the company agreed upon with investors.

item.title: Mpox vaccine maker Bavarian Nordic seeks ‘critical’ EU approval for teens after WHO declares health emergency
item.description: CEO Paul Chaplin told CNBC that the expanded approval for 12- to 17-year-olds would be crucial in tackling the latest outbreak.

item.title: Europe stocks close higher to round off winning week; Sterling gains after slew of UK data
item.description: European stocks close higher as the Stoxx 600 index continued to climb.

item.title: Alibaba, JD.com results underscore the slowdown in Chinese consumer demand
item.description: Second-quarter results from Chinese e-commerce giants Alibaba and JD.com indicate a weak market, with domestic and foreign players struggling to attract customers.

item.title: Replacing China in copper supply chain is 'unfeasible,' warns WoodMac, as the West seeks shift
item.description: Efforts from Western economies to diversify away from China's copper supply chain could raise costs and delay the energy transition, says Wood Mackenzie.

item.title: Earn less, relax more: An American who moved to Lithuania describes life in the world’s happiest country for young people
item.description: An American who moved to Lithuania in 2012 says he earns less money but the trade off is worth it for a better quality of life, free healthcare, and safety.

item.title: After medic's rape and murder, Indian doctors stage 24-hour nationwide strike
item.description: The Indian Medical Association has called for a suspension of non-emergency medical services from Saturday 6 am local time.

item.title: China's central bank says risks from local government debt have dropped
item.description: China's financial risks have dropped, including from local government debt, People's Bank of China Governor Pan Gongsheng said in interviews with state media.

item.title: Japan's Nikkei soars over 3% to clock best week in 4 years amid a broad rally in Asia markets
item.description: Traders in Asia digested non-oil exports data from Singapore, which massively beat Reuters' poll expectations

item.title: North Korea to reopen for international visitors, tour operators say
item.description: North Korea will resume international tourism this winter, ending a COVID-era ban on travelers, according to operators that organize trips to the country.

item.title: Warren Buffett did something curious with his Apple stock holding
item.description: The identical 400 million share count in Apple and Buffett's oldest and longest position Coca-Cola prompted some to believe he is done selling the tech stock.

item.title: A $1.4 million vacation? Take a look inside a yacht that costs that much per week
item.description: The 255-foot superyacht Malia hit the market in 2023 with a price tag of $120 million. But she can be yours for $1.4 million per week.

item.title: Alibaba earnings miss expectations despite cloud acceleration
item.description: Alibaba continues to face headwinds in its core e-commerce business amid rising competition and a cautious Chinese consumer.

item.title: Ex-Google CEO Eric Schmidt sees Nvidia as big AI winner: 'You know what to do in the stock market'
item.description: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt said in a recent talk at Stanford that, while he isn't giving investment advice, Nvidia is the top beneficiary of the AI boom.

item.title: China's bond market intervention reveals financial stability worries
item.description: The country's latest efforts to stem a bond market rally shows that authorities are worried about financial stability, analysts said.

item.title: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg receives letter from lawmakers concerned about illicit drug ads on Facebook and Instagram
item.description: A bipartisan group of lawmakers sent Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg a letter expressing concern about illicit drug advertisements running on the company's apps.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: Could Hindenburg's latest allegations have wider implications for India?
item.description: Unusually, Hindenburg — a short-seller that makes money when stocks fall — is attacking a market regulator, rather than a specific stock.

item.title: Tencent-backed Airwallex hits $500 million annualized sales, aims to get IPO-ready by 2026
item.description: Payments startup Airwallex has reached an annual revenue run rate of $500 million and will be ready for an IPO by 2026, CEO Jack Zhang told CNBC.
